item.title: 波动性下降，华尔街学者将购买 500 亿美元股票
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）赢得总统大选所引发的股市大涨正在触发基于规则的投资基金的买入信号，为涨势火上浇油。【原文：The stock-market surge unleashed by Donald Trump’s presidential victory is triggering buy signals for rules-based investment funds, adding fuel to the rally.】

item.title: 特朗普将征收更多关税，但首席执行官们坚称他们已做好准备
item.description: 几个月来，经济学家们已经发出了明确的警报：振作起来。他们警告说，如果唐纳德-特朗普兑现竞选时的承诺，积极推出一揽子新的美国关税措施，那么再次当选的他将为全球经济进入历史性的动荡时期埋下伏笔。【原文：The alarm from economists has been clear for months: Brace yourself. If he delivers on his campaign promises for an aggressive package of new US tariffs, they’ve warned, a re-elected Donald Trump will set the stage for a historic period of turmoil in the global economy.】

item.title: 网络安全公司 Qualys 探讨潜在出售事宜
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，Qualys 公司在收到收购意向后，正在探索包括潜在出售在内的各种选择，因为网络安全领域的整合有望加速。该公司股价涨幅高达 33%。【原文：Qualys Inc. is exploring options including a potential sale after receiving takeover interest, people familiar with the matter said, as consolidation is expected to accelerate in the cybersecurity sector. The stock rose as much as 33%.】

item.title: 收益率上升笼罩着股市在特朗普风险影响下的涨势
item.description: 共和党人唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在总统大选中获胜后，华尔街一片喜气洋洋，推动美国股市在夏季以来的最佳交易时段创下历史新高。【原文：Wall Street’s happy-go-lucky mood after Republican Donald Trump’s victory in the presidential election is propelling US stocks to record highs in their best session since the summer.】

item.title: 炸弹威胁、虚假视频未能颠覆美国大选
item.description: 2024 年 10 月 27 日星期日，在美国佐治亚州亚特兰大市，一名选民在 Flipper Temple AME 内的投票点提前投票时标记选票。据爱默生学院（Emerson College）进行的一项最新全国调查显示，在美国总统大选前几天，唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）和副总统卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）在可能投票的选民中以各49%的支持率打成平手。【原文：A voter marks their ballot at a polling location inside Flipper Temple AME during early voting in Atlanta, Georgia, US, on Sunday, Oct 27, 2024. Donald Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris are tied with 49% support each among likely voters just days before the US presidential election, according to a new national survey conducted by Emerson College.】

item.title: 科技巨头为人工智能改革和特朗普 2.0 时代的反垄断倒退做好准备
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）重返白宫后，承诺取消前任政府的许多政策，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）也将发挥重要作用，硅谷正准备好与美国政府建立截然不同的关系。【原文：Silicon Valley is bracing for a vastly different relationship with the US government as Donald Trump returns to the White House with promises to undo many of his predecessor’s policies and Elon Musk poised to play an influential role.】

item.title: 特朗普获胜后，伊朗蓬勃发展的石油产量受到审查
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）即将重返白宫，这使伊朗蓬勃发展的石油流再次成为人们关注的焦点；当选总统也有可能再次试图压制伊朗的石油流。【原文：Donald Trump’s impending return to the White House has brought Iran’s booming oil flows back into focus — as well as the possibility that the president-elect will once again try to crush them.】

item.title: 特朗普获胜后，债券交易商通过看跌期权下注净赚数百万美元
item.description: 在国债期权市场上，投机者似乎正在兑现几周前下的赌注，即受益于收益率的飙升，并很可能净赚数百万美元。【原文：In the market for Treasury options, speculators appear to be cashing in on bets placed a few weeks ago that would benefit from a jump in yields, and are likely netting millions of dollars in profits.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长维勒鲁瓦称特朗普大选给全球经济带来风险
item.description: 法国央行行长弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）表示，唐纳德-特朗普当选下一任美国总统给全球经济带来了风险和不确定性，应鼓励欧洲解决自身的弱点。【原文：The election of Donald Trump as the next US president raises risks and uncertainty for the global economy and should encourage Europe to address its weaknesses, Bank of France Governor Francois Villeroy de Galhau said.】

item.title: 南达科他州将废除输油管法律，对美国乙醇造成打击
item.description: 一条耗资 89 亿美元的碳捕集管道提案使美国玉米带出现两极分化，该提案在至关重要的南达科他州再次受挫。【原文：A proposed $8.9-billion carbon-capture pipeline that has polarized the US Corn Belt has hit another setback in the critical state of South Dakota.】

item.title: 唐纳德-特朗普拥有在第二任期解雇强大金融监管机构的工具
item.description: 罗希特-乔普拉（Rohit Chopra）对非法收回汽车、取消抵押品赎回权和银行透支收费的打击，使他成为消费者团体的英雄和贷款机构的敌人。【原文：Rohit Chopra’s crackdowns on illegal car repossessions, home foreclosures and bank overdraft fees made him a hero to consumer groups and a foe of lenders.】

item.title: Advent公司酝酿以50亿欧元出售仿制药制造商Zentiva
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，收购公司 Advent International 正在考虑出售仿制药生产商 Zentiva，这笔交易可能会使这家前赛诺菲子公司的估值达到约 50 亿欧元（54 亿美元）。【原文：Buyout firm Advent International is considering the sale of generic drugmaker Zentiva, in a deal that could value the former Sanofi unit at about €5 billion ($5.4 billion), according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 沙特计划斥资 1000 亿美元打造人工智能中心，与阿联酋的科技中心相抗衡
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，沙特阿拉伯正在计划一个新的人工智能项目，该项目将获得多达 1,000 亿美元的资金支持，以发展一个技术中心，与邻国阿拉伯联合酋长国相抗衡。【原文：Saudi Arabia is planning a new artificial intelligence project with backing of as much as $100 billion as it seeks to develop a technological hub to rival the neighboring United Arab Emirates, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: Polymarket 的法国鲸鱼获得 4,800 万美元的特朗普大奖
item.description: 周三，许多参与加密货币市场的人都有理由为唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的获胜而沾沾自喜，但一位受到密切关注的法国交易商的赌注却准备为大选结果支付数百万美元。【原文：Many people involved in crypto markets had reason to gloat on Wednesday about Donald Trump’s win, but one closely watched French trader’s bets are poised to pay out millions of dollars on the election’s outcome.】

item.title: 大选引发的美元大涨加剧了特朗普的货币问题
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）赢得大选后，美元能否持续飙升，取决于他重返白宫后会兑现哪些竞选承诺。【原文：The sustainability of the dollar’s surge in the wake of Donald Trump’s election victory pivots on which of his campaign promises he pursues once back in the White House.】

item.title: 特朗普取得决定性胜利后，抵押债券仍有发展空间
item.description: 新机构抵押贷款债券的风险溢价周三收紧，因为一些人认为在大选前这个市场异常便宜，有望与美国股市和美元一起受益。【原文：Risk premiums on new agency mortgage bonds tightened Wednesday, as a market some considered unusually cheap before the election was poised to benefit along with the likes of US equities and the dollar.】

item.title: 谢因鲍姆呼吁保持冷静，美国投票后墨西哥股市跌势减弱
item.description: 在美国最大的贸易伙伴和南部邻国唐纳德-特朗普决定性地赢得大选之后，墨西哥人应该保持冷静，美国总统在当地市场开始从最初的震惊中恢复过来时说了一句务实的话。【原文：Mexicans should remain calm in the wake of Donald Trump’s decisive election win, the president of the US’s largest trading partner and southern neighbor said, sounding a note of pragmatism as local markets began to recover from their initial shock.】

item.title: M&A观察家预计特朗普将点燃交易复苏之火
item.description: 据预测，唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫将为更多大手笔并购埋下种子。【原文：Donald Trump’s return to the White House is predicted to seed the ground for more big-ticket mergers and acquisitions.】

item.title: 特朗普的回归将再次颠覆美国农民的贸易处境
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普的连任有望再次动摇美国农业的格局。【原文：Donald Trump’s reelection promises another shakeup for American agriculture.】

item.title: 特朗普的关税升级计划为何遭到如此多的仇视？
item.description: 美国在其历史上的大部分时期都对进口产品征收重税，但从 20 世纪 30 年代开始，随着政府领导人接受自由贸易的理念，美国基本上放弃了这一政策。高关税在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）2017-2021 年担任总统期间卷土重来，他采用高关税的目的是为了振兴美国制造业，并对抗美国认为是中国的不公平贸易行为。特朗普的继任者乔-拜登保持了这一趋势。【原文：The US heavily taxed imports for much of its history before largely abandoning the policy, beginning in the 1930s, as government leaders embraced the idea of free trade. High tariffs made a comeback during the 2017-2021 presidency of Donald Trump, who adopted them in an effort to revitalize American manufacturing and to counter what the US regards as China’s unfair trade practices. Trump’s successor Joe Biden kept the trend going.】

item.title: 关于刚刚发生的事情和即将发生的事情的九点思考
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 特朗普获胜改变美元走势，卢布跌至两年低点
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在美国总统大选中获胜后，加元兑美元汇率跌至两年来的最低点。【原文：The Canadian dollar slumped to its lowest in two years against the US currency after Donald Trump surged to victory in the American presidential election.】

item.title: 迈克尔-诺沃格拉茨（Michael Novogratz）放弃的交易计划显示了特朗普获胜的惊人速度
item.description: 周二晚上，当选举地图开始填上蓝色和红色时，华尔街亿万富翁迈克尔-诺沃格拉茨（Michael Novogratz）躺在床上，手里拿着两部电话和一对笔记本电脑。他身边放着一瓶杰克-丹尼尔（Jack Daniel's）威士忌、一瓶香槟和一品脱柠檬雪酪。【原文：Wall Street billionaire Michael Novogratz sprawled out on his bed with two phones and a pair of laptops as the election maps began to fill in blue and red Tuesday night. At his side was a bottle of Jack Daniel’s, another of Champagne and a pint of lemon sherbet.】

item.title: 海湾街称特朗普胜选将长期提振多伦多证券交易所
item.description: 海湾街（Bay Street）的分析师和投资组合经理认为，唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的胜选从长远来看将增强加拿大股市，尽管最初的市场反应使加拿大股市落后于美国股市。【原文：Bay Street analysts and portfolio managers believe Donald Trump’s victory will strengthen Canadian stocks in the long run, even as initial market reaction left Canadian equities trailing US stocks.】

item.title: 华尔街对特朗普的赌注得到回报，ETF 投注得到平反
item.description: 华尔街的交易员们在一系列 ETF 上豪赌数十亿美元，希望在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）重返总统宝座时大获其利。【原文：Wall Street traders who threw caution to the wind by lavishing billions of dollars on a slew of ETF bets that would win big in the event of a Donald Trump presidential comeback are seeing their wagers pay off.】

item.title: 交易商评估特朗普赢得大选的影响，石油价格出现波动
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）赢得大选将加快经济增长的押注与美国市场的利空数据交织在一起，导致石油价格波动。【原文：Oil fluctuated as bets that Donald Trump’s election win will accelerate economic growth vied with bearish market data from the US.】

item.title: 特朗普获胜为 "休眠 "的房地美、房利美交易注入强心剂
item.description: 由于市场猜测唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）将使房利美（Fannie Mae）和房地美（Freddie Mac）这两家住房融资机构摆脱危机时期的保全监管，这两家公司发行的长期濒临破产的优先股股价周三大涨。【原文：Shares of long-moribund preferred stock issued by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac surged on Wednesday amid speculation that Donald Trump will free the housing finance agencies from their crisis-era conservatorship.】

item.title: Capital One 和 Discover 因特朗普获胜放宽合并审批而飙升
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）重返白宫，有望平息人们对 Capital One 金融公司（Capital One Financial Corp.【原文：Donald Trump’s return to the White House is poised to mollify lingering doubts that Capital One Financial Corp. will be allowed to take over Discover Financial Services, one of the biggest mergers announced this year.】

item.title: 特朗普政策为英格兰银行未来降息之路蒙上阴影
item.description: 英国央行本周将再次降息四分之一个百分点，但唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）连任美国总统给英国未来的宽松政策带来了新的不确定性。【原文：The Bank of England is all but assured to cut interest rates by another quarter point this week, but a second US presidential term for Donald Trump has cast new uncertainty over future policy easing in the UK.】

item.title: 特朗普胜选破坏全球降息预期
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普成功重返美国总统宝座后，全世界的央行行长们都在估量，他们对特朗普的最坏担心是否会成为现实。【原文：Central bankers the world over are gauging whether their worst fears over Donald Trump will come to pass following his resounding return to the US presidency.】
